title: 2001 Norwegian First Division
text:
The 2001 <a href="1.%20divisjon">1. divisjon</a>, <a href="Norway">Norway's</a> second-tier <a href="association%20football">football</a> league, began on 21 April 2001 and ended on 28 October 2001. The league was contested by 16 teams, and the top two teams won promotion to <a href="Tippeligaen">Tippeligaen</a>, while the third place team played a promotion-playoff against the 12th-placed team in Tippeligaen to win promotion. The bottom four teams were relegated to the <a href="2.%20divisjon">2. divisjon</a>.
Team changes from 2000.
<a href="2000%201.%20divisjon">2000 1. divisjon</a> champions <a href="FK%20Lyn">FK Lyn</a> and runners-up <a href="Str%C3%B8msgodset%20IF">Strømsgodset</a> were promoted to the <a href="2001%20Tippeligaen">2001 Tippeligaen</a>. They were replaced by <a href="IK%20Start">Start</a> and <a href="FK%20Haugesund">Haugesund</a>, who finished 13th and 14th respectively in the <a href="2000%20Tippeligaen">2000 Tippeligaen season</a>.
Due to the enlargement from 14 to 16 teams in 2001, only two teams, <a href="Strindheim%20IL">Strindheim</a> and <a href="Eik-T%C3%B8nsberg">Eik-Tønsberg</a>, were relegated to the <a href="2001%202.%20divisjon">2001 2. divisjon</a> following the 2000 season. They were replaced by <a href="2000%202.%20divisjon">2000 2. divisjon</a> <a href="Playoffs%20to%20the%201.%20divisjon%232000">play-off</a> winners <a href="FK%20Mandalskameratene">Mandalskameratene</a>, <a href="FK%20%C3%98rn-Horten">Ørn-Horten</a>, <a href="IL%20H%C3%B8dd">Hødd</a> and <a href="Aalesunds%20FK">Aalesund</a>. Mandalskameratene made their first appearance at the second tier since 1952–53.
One further spots were available through relegation/promotion play-offs. <a href="Sogndal%20Fotball">Sogndal</a> successfully promoted to Tippeligaen by beating Tippeligaen side <a href="V%C3%A5lerenga%20Fotball">Vålerenga</a> on away goals (3–3 on aggregate) in the <a href="2000%20Tippeligaen%23Relegation/Promotion">Tippeligaen play-off</a>, sending the team from <a href="Oslo">Oslo</a> to the second tier of Norwegian football.
Season summary.
<a href="V%C3%A5lerenga%20Fotball">Vålerenga</a> and <a href="IK%20Start">Start</a> won promotion to Tippeligaen, after only one season in the First Division, while <a href="Hamarkameratene">Ham-Kam</a> lost the promotion-playoff against <a href="Bryne%20FK">Bryne</a>. <a href="FK%20Mandalskameratene">Mandalskameratene</a>, <a href="KIL%20Toppfotball">Kongsvinger</a>, <a href="Kjels%C3%A5s%20Fotball">Kjelsås</a> and <a href="By%C3%A5sen%20Toppfotball">Byåsen</a> were relegated to the 2. divisjon.
In the decisive match of the season, <a href="FK%20%C3%98rn-Horten">Ørn-Horten</a> scored twice in the stoppage time in the match against <a href="V%C3%A5lerenga%20Fotball">Vålerenga</a>. Ørn-Horten's goalkeeper Helge Fjeld scored the winning goal five minutes into stoppage time, and kept Ørn-Horten clear of relegation, at the expense of Mandalskameratene.
<a href="Bala%20Garba">Bala Garba</a> and <a href="Marino%20Rahmberg">Marino Rahmberg</a> became top goalscorers with 18 goals each.
